article.title: SAIC Selected for Ship Motion Forecasting Program
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Science Applications International Corporation, McLean, Virginia, is being awarded almost $15 million for the environment and ship motion forecasting program, which seeks to provide sea-based ship and cargo system operators with seaway environmental forecasting in order to predict ship motions and determine windows of opportunity for inter-intra-ship material and personnel environment.Â The Office of Naval Research, Arlington, Virginia, is the contracting activity.
